intro: Verbesina macbridei, commonly known as the MacBride's beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in disturbed areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
